Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent Place to Stay in Downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: scottpajason
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a couple of nights for a wedding. We were given a special room rate of $159/night. Apparently, the rooms go for around $200 plus, normally. Location is great. About a block from Canal on Camp St. The lobby is nice and spacious. They have the usual free breakfast offerred at La Quintas. But, you need to get there early to get the popular items like bananas and eggs. The other reviews mention this, too. But, it's New Orleans, and you really should venture into the Quarter at least once for a good breakfast. The rooms are decent, updated, and fairly modern. Some king rooms are larger than others. The staff was friendly and even accomodated our early check in. The only downside to this hotel, and probably is like this with most of the cheaper downtown hotels, is the potential for loud and drunk guests. There was a large group of highschool or young college students staying on our floor who felt the need to party and/or argue near the elevators and in the hallway both nights. But, a call to the front desk handled it quickly. All in all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Stephen L
Reviews.Content: I went down there with my friend to check out bourbon street and really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was a few blocks away from bourbon street which was great because it was quiet but also within walking distance of all the fun. If your a girl the walk can get a bit sketchy on the way back to the hotel so I wouldn't go it alone. I think this hotel is very clean and provides great value. The gym and pool are average but we used them. The continental breakfast was standard and the laundry facility was just what we needed. I thought the overall experience was great and I travel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok but service not good”
Reviews.Author: NewTraveller37
Reviews.Content: We arrived late to check in (as we informed them) and they only had one room available not two. After suffering the indignity of having to squeeze into one room, the next morning they found that there was in fact another room booked after all. The guy the previous evening simply didn't know how to check us in, even though it was fully paid for and he had the Hotels.com paperwork I gave him. He also swiped my Travel Card which caused the full amount of $750 to be withheld even though I had prepaid in full! We didn't have enough money to do any tours! This really impacted our holiday. Even transferring extra money took 3 days so our trip was wasted. It took a good 3 weeks for the hold to be lifted! I have sent an email to La Quinta but have not heard a response. All I request is a small refund for the first night's inconvenience due to lack of second room even though I had prepaid. I thought that there would be great service because these La Quintas are everywhere and a large company. The room itself was nice, but there was an interconnecting door and I could here everything the people next door said when they were in the bathroom. The actual hotel is nice and in a great position near the French Quarter and the riverside. Breakfast was great but it was hard to find a table. I wish they trained their staff a little better and focused on customer service and responded to email complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Elena N
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful location--few blocks walk to everything and safe and quiet at the same time. Friendly staff, impeccable cleanness and very reasonable breakfast. I would definitely stay there again and wold recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was good. Was not overly impressed with staff. They were helpful with directions to places in the city and pleasant. When we asked for blankets for the pull out couch, we were told they were out. Who can sleep without a blanket? The breakfast was hectic. Not enough seating and they didn't seem to restock things they were out of, so if you got there late, you were out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: msalga2
Reviews.Content: An easy walk (just a few blocks) to the French Quarter. Good continental breakfast. Our room was clean and special requests (extra pillows) were handled quickly. Pool is VERY small. Over all - a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “We had an EXCELLENT stay!”
Reviews.Author: Karl Z
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive hotel with free parking. Priceline said they had free parking, but there were some questionable comments so I called the hotel before booking. The front desk answered promply, but did say that while parking was available, it was not free as Priceline indicated. The rate wasn't too bad and we were really glad we chose this hotel. Room was clean, comfortable, and pet friendly as it turned out. We could have brought our dog, but what is the point if you want to explore the city. Breakfast was great, staff very helpful. No problems in walking to Riverwalk, French Quarter, and the Aquarium. We would seek out this hotel on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marvin M
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NOLA and we were a bit aprehensive about the safety and area. The hotel was fabulous, no concerns about safety. We walked to the French Quarter every day. The location is the greatest and the staff was helpful and friendly. We recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Gomez
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay and I would surely recommend this hotel. The room was spacious, bed was very comfortable and staff super friendly. Walking distance to bourbon street, riverfront and many attractions. The only downfall would be the breakfast. The items are the usual, cerea, fruit, waffle iron. If you do not get there by 6:30 forget it, the room tiny and not worth the crowd. The lady that is responsible for maintaining the are looked bored and seemed to no care that coffee was out and trash was full, and that was all the time! I walked a few blocks down to Daisy Dukes instead! All and all a great stay and I would do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay @”
Reviews.Author: Joey C
Reviews.Content: This place is conveniently locate on Camp near Canal. Bourbon St. is around the corner. The rooms are very nice. The gentleman at the front desk was so nice! The only problem was that there was a technical difficulty with my reservation. However, the gentleman who was there that night helped me call around to AT LEAST 10 different hotels to help find me and my travel companions a room. He really went out of his way and I honestly think I may have forgotten to thank him thinking I'd see him the next day. I will definately stay here again. They even allowed my pets to stay! Our room was huge, clean, and spacious with an great view.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta - good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne R
Reviews.Content: La Quinta is, as always, a good deal for the money, even in areas like next to the French Quarter. The room was immaculate, the staff very helpful, the amenities more than stellar.

Reviews.Title: “PreCruise Hotel in New Orleans - You Can't Go Wrong!”
Reviews.Author: msp2phl
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent and the location to to the French Quarter and WWII Museum was fantastic. We selected this hotel based on price and location and wasn't disapponited. The room was large and clean and made it comfortable for all the luggage we were taking on the cruise. The hotel staff was very friendly and customer service focused. The front desk staff even offered to store our luggage post cruise if we had time to come back and explore the city. This isn't a five star hotel if that is what your looking for.If your looking for a nice middle of the road hotel to sleep and bath and focused on value and location you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Time...Again!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Mi_Mi34
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Mardi Gras for the past dozen years. Yes, it can be an expensive venture. This is what I have learned to expect when I travel at this peak time. And for the past 5 years I have stayed at the La Quinta. The hotel is definitely overpriced for Mardi Gras, but you get comfort and relaxation after your booze-filled nights on Bourbon Street. And the walk to & from Bourbon Street/French Quarter is very short. The hotel price also includes a wholesome Continental breakfast. The breakfast isn't extravagant, but filling enough to cut your breakfast budget. The maids are very accommodating as well during this time, offering later than normal turn-over service.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great place!”
Reviews.Author: nic_817
Reviews.Content: We stayed in La Quinta Inn and Suites in New Orleans for 4 nights. We loved it! The price was reasonable and the location was perfect - within walking distance of all the attractions: French Quarter, Casino, WWII Museum, Superdome, etc. In fact, we only took a cab once and that was back to the airport. The location is safe and the complimentary breakfast was one of the best we've seen for a hotel in this price range. We had a leak in our room and they immediately moved us to a new room. The only downside to the hotel is that the walls are thin, so you can sometimes hear people talking.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: TGDofATL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location twice - once for 2 nights before a cruise in 2010, and another for 1 night on a road trip in late 2011. We are fans of La Quinta and this is an excellent property - one of the more updated and contemporary ones. Parking is valet only, but the charge is on par with other hotels and lots in the area. There is a short 1 block walk to the French Quarter. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and each time the staff has been very helpful and friendly. Not the place to stay if you're looking for a view or to be in the heart of the Quarter, or if you expect luxury. But really, if you're in New Orleans, why would you want to stay in the hotel the whole time anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Got the job done”
Reviews.Author: BluesDoctor
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is the best if you are looking for a weekend to enjoy both the F.Q. and the WW2 Museum and don't mind a little walking. Easy to get in and valet parking not much more that parking independently. The rooms were clean and comfortable but nothing exceptional. Coffee maker and free internet as all hotels SHOULD have. No in-room safe but the front desk has individual lock boxes for no charge. The breakfast is mainly continental light fare. A storage area is available to keep your luggage for that last N.O. meal after check-out. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: crissycurry
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room was nice and roomy. The front desk clerks were friendly. The breakfast was what I would define as deluxe continental: fruit, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, toast, bagels, waffle-making station. The valets were quick in getting our vehicle to us when we needed it, but we called ahead before going down to get it. The hotel was in a great and quiet location. The only complaint I have is that you had to almost slam the doors to get them to shut completely.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected/needed”
Reviews.Author: Jessie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently to visit the city for some early Mardi Gras action. The room was amazing--really nice and huge bathroom for this level of hotel. We brought our dog and the hotel was very friendly about it. There were several dogs around so it wasn't like we were the only weirdos that travel with our pet. :) Not once walking around in the hotel did I hear barking either. The walk to Canal St. and the start of the French Quarter was between 5-10 minutes, very easy and nice. We parked our car here with valet parking and they were very nice. I can't remember the exact price, maybe mid to high $20's? Anyways, we got there early and although we couldn't check in early due to the pet friendly rooms not being clean yet, they were very nice and allowed us to go ahead and valet our car and check our bags. The breakfast spread was great but I remember it being crowded so we just grabbed some muffins and left. The people at the desk were really nice and the value of this hotel couldn't be better. If we ever go back to New Orleans, we'll stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This is by far the worst customer service La Quinta EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous a
Reviews.Content: I never have a problem changing my reservation at any other La Quinta or booking a room with my LQ Returns points. But everytime I want to make or change my reservation at this La Quinta, it is one of the most difficult things to do. Hotels.com said the hotel's cancellation policy was the prior day of arrival at 6pm. I called around 5:30 pm the prior day of arrival and this La Quinta refused to change my reservation because the actual hotel was saying their cancellation policy is 4pm the prior day of arrival. I got charged for 2 nights by this hotel. All I wanted to do is change to next day arrival for the same number of nights. But to this hotel, it was more important to collect my money than understand their customer was told by hotels.com that I had until 6pm. All that LQ would say to me is that since the hotel will not change the reservation, there is nothing they can do and they can help me make another reservation. Now why in the world would I make another reservation at a hotel that just got done charging me. To me, businesses have to prove to me they deserve my money and business, but this hotel didnt care so I took my business somewhere else, no matter the competitor prices. (COUNTRY INN & SUITES is right down the road and they are around the same price and very nice). Also, me being a LQ Returns Elite member qualifies me for no blackout dates but everytime I have tried using my points to book at this hotel, they would not honor my Elite membership status. I have never had a problem changing my reservation at any other La Quinta and was never penalized for it (especailly charged 2 nights). So all in all what I am trying to say is that this hotel is nice and new, but their customer relation that most other hotels build, this property does not care!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for the money in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: dontSeattle
Reviews.Content: We are only echoing what many other reviewers have said about this hotel. It can't be beat in New Orleans. It is an elegant hotel with very spacious rooms and a great breakfast in a quite area just off the French Quarter. While you have to walk a short block and a half and cross Camp to get to the French Quarter, it is well worth it. This was our second visit to New Orleans on our current road trip and this hotel far exceeds the first one - the Holiday Inn in the Quarter - that cost much more. Whenever we come back to New Orleans, we will book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta fan”
Reviews.Author: tripper69
Reviews.Content: staff weree great , little cafe across the street is great..

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Gem”
Reviews.Author: cardman760
Reviews.Content: The LaQuinta - just outside the French Quarter - is outstanding. We were there over a busy pre-Mardi Gras weekend and a few of the guests got a little loud on our floor at 2 in the morning. Security came up and calmed things down - and the next morning, the manager called and provided a $100 credit to our account! Service was very good and I can't think of a better location for a reasonable price in what is usually an over-priced hotel room city.

Reviews.Title: “Pre and Post cruise”
Reviews.Author: MoogeyMomma
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel is a good location. Summer, the front desk clerk was extremely nice and helpful. Close to everything, within easy walking distance to Bourbon St, Harrah's, Canal St, etc... Ice and vending machines on every other floor, less convient. Rooms clean. Sound proof? NOT. You hear all the doors slaming, people talking and walking down hallways. Even the toilets make alot of noise. Continental breakfast area very crowded and leaves alot to be desired. I recommend going across the street to "Dress It" limited menu but excellent food for both breakfast and dinner (burgers). Would also recommend walking down the street toward Canal to "Red Gravy". Nice little italian restaurant. Good food, good prices. A/C doesn't work to well.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed while at dinner....”
Reviews.Author: Kris B
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Feb 2012 before our cruise. While we were at dinner someone robbed our room and shuffled thru all our suitcases. Police and management were called. Management said our door had not be closed all the way. Now I see on here someone else was robbed at the same hotel. I think they have a problem. Either with the doors being closed but not locked or with the staff. Either way I learned a costly lesson. The hotel is a great location.... but I would never stay there again.... oh yea Management did credit our room for the night. But still charged us for parking. If you choose to stay here I suggest you leave you valuables in the car or carry with you. Someone is making a killing off this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my very best experience in staying ...”
Reviews.Author: batpeace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just wonderfull to say the least its modern yet keeps the feel of a good ol new orleans hotel. The front desk and valet check in was excellent the price was perfect however the room was more perfect. The view of the city street and all the old buildings was great the french doors to the bathroom with the wooden floors was absouletly beautiful. We stayed a total of three nights we were only scheduled to stay one night but the room was so comfortable and refreshing we stayed a extra two nights while playing hookie from our jobs. Would love to live the experience over again, the location was perfect never got back in our car until we left. Loved it. Loved it and loved it. No negitives here

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Not right in the Quarter but only a short walk to get to all the fun!”
Reviews.Author: Tropicats
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay, & priced very reasonable. Close enough to the French Quarter to walk which is great for after dinner walks from the awesome French Quarter Restaurants. The hotel is very pet friendly leaving 1 entire floor for those of us that travel with pets knowing that most dog owners will be more understanding of some pet's bad habits. It works! Don't expect to walk your dog right out the hotel door - the park for that is about 3 blocks away making late walks kind of nerve racking. Always a good idea to use the buddy system for walks, a good idea in most cities. All in all, the hotel is a very nice place to stay with friendly employees. Don't forget that it is Valet Parking but the service was fast!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly would stay again”
Reviews.Author: summerfuninwintersun
Reviews.Content: I came to New Orleans for a weather conference and spent a week at the hotel. It was located close to all the activities and unless you have trouble walking there is no reason to rent a care. The hotel and the rooms were very clean. The employees were all very kind, helpful and are more than willing to assist with your needs. We stayed here for the continental breakfast as we had many young adults with us that needed to save money where possible. The fruit and muffins were just fine and the waffles made the hungry crew so happy. Highlights: front desk help, location, breakfast, cleanliness. Cons: Internet was very slow at times in the rooms and had to go to the business room to get better connection.

Reviews.Title: “Was the first stay a fluke?”
Reviews.Author: mcmadnes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the La Quinta June of 2009 and found it to be well cared for and the people to be friendly so I booked another, longer stay in November 2011. The room was dirty and the more I complained to the front desk (who was very nice, by the way) the less that was done in the room. Spreads were pulled up over sheets that were kicked to the bottom of the bed, with no attempt to make the bed. Wet towels were left in the bathroom and the bathroom floor was not cleaned the whole time we were there. The A/C did not work and we had to keep calling the desk or going down every half hour and was told the repairman would be there "any minute now". Eventually he did come and took the cover off and got it started. The next day, we returned to the room and it seemed the only thing housekeeping did was turn off the A/C. Back to the desk again and again. I must say I was always greeted with a smile and promised help from the desk people. They deserve to work somewhere else. After the third day of A/c problems, we decided to take it upon ourselves to figure out the A/C, although I was hesitant to take off the cover. Eventually , we found it was the thermostat that was dis-functual. If you pushed the thermostat over 75 degrees, the A/C would blast cold air until you toes hurt and we had to turn it off. I did report the problems to the desk and even after returning home, sent a complaint to La Quinta management. Still waiting for their "24 hour response. Going to New Orleans in May and am definitely not staying in the La Quinta. Booking a trip to San Diego in November and will not even consider this Hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Machet
Reviews.Content: Went up with my son to visit the LSU campus and stayed in NO 2 nights. Did not want to spend much on hotel (being just us two guys) and booked La Quinta french quarter at $114/nt. To my surprise the Hotel was ideally situated just 2 blocks (5 min walk) from the French Quarter yet far enough to get a quiet nights sleep. The rooms were modern and well equipped . The beds were comfortable and breakfast included in the price. Parking was $26/day which was a little steep but not unreasonable. Service was good all around , though not always with a smile and pets are welcomed .Nice stay for what we needed ..would recommend for location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MegailnSonja
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this LaQuinta; both times, we visited for New Years. The location is perfect, just 2 blocks from Canal Street and close to Bourbon Street. The only 1 thing we had an issue with was the air conditioner; it stated it was 68 degrees in the room, but we both felt it was more warm than that. We didn't spend too much time in the hotel room, and had already unpacked, so we didn't worry about it and just dealt with it. But there were many bright sides to this hotel that will bring us back for a 3rd time this year. The location is perfect; and even better, they have a 'carport valet' that you can pull your car into. When we've stayed at other, cheaper hotels in New Orleans, but it gets very frustrating when you have to park your car in the middle of the street and stand by it so you don't get towed, while waiting for the valet to come move your car. At La Quinta, you have a driveway you can actually pull into for the valet. It is about $26/night, with in and out privileges, but well worth it. If you call 5 minutes ahead, they will have your car waiting for you downstairs. In addition, the breakfast is pretty good, and the hotel is very clean. We have never brought a pet here, but we saw plenty of pets; and for a hotel that allows pets, La Quinta was very clean and pristine. I never would have guessed they allowed pets! The beds and pillows are very comfortable, and we love the flat screens on the walls. We had a great view from the 14th floor, facing Harrah's and the bridge. We also needed directions several times, and the front desk associates were very helpful and took the time to ensure we understood the directions so wouldn't get lost. I can't say enough good things about this La Quinta location. It's a great value, great location, and an overall fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed. Treated like criminals.”
Reviews.Author: nfbV
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the french quarter festival in April 2011, while the hotel is the nicest La Quinta i have stayed in the service was remarkably bad. Our hotel room was robbed while we sleeping. When I reported it the GM (probably not the GM but a suit) had no idea how to help me or what to do. Then tried yo b.s. me. What he did do was blame myself and my girlfriend for the robbery. My shorts (with all my money, phone, wallet, etc) were stolen and he actually said, " It wouldn't be the first time someone lost there shorts in New Orleans. We had two bags and a pair of shorts stolen, we had no money and were in New Orleans. This manager and his staff made the worst impression and I will never stay at any La Quinta again. Despite the fact that the night before in Kenner, LA we had the best stay and had decided to choose La Quinta whenever we could. That feeling lasted 24 hours. Luckily, we had a jar of quarters and since the staff was zero help and accusatory and the police never came, we made it all the way to Sanibel, Fl on a jar of quarters. They had an opportunity to make us life long La Quinta stayers or not. We're not.

Reviews.Title: “Watch iout for BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: juan32250
Reviews.Content: first they triple the price of the rooms on some nights, then they don't vacuum, then there is no parking but valet at $30+ per day (not noted on website), then the bedbugs which they deny until after finally five days the general manager responds to calls, he did comp two of the cheap days at least. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but very average overall”
Reviews.Author: ribar1en
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November due to a conference at the Sheraton which was just a block away. The prices were incredibly cheap and we did appreciate the fact that there was no charge for bringing our dog. In fact, we saw quite a few dogs while we were there. However, like other reviewers have noted, there isn't any grass really nearby. It is a good 2 block walk if you have a dog like mine that needs grass to do her business. Anyhow...we stayed on the top floor in the 2 room suite. The room was incredibly spacious and we largely avoided the noise from the street by being up so high. The room through was far less clean than I like. There were gobs of dust piled on the air unit and there were stains on the couch and the such. However, if you are looking for a cheap getaway, this is your place. It's the ability to stay near Bourbon without the smell or hassle. Also...there's a GREAT wine/tapas bar just a few doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but be persistent with your requests”
Reviews.Author: PDun
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the laquinta inn and suites in the French quarter is definitely the location. It is close enough to bourbon street to walk easily there but far enough away to be able to sleep out of the noise. When we first checked in we were given a room on the second floor. When we looked out the window there was no view whatsoever and in fact it looked out onto a service courtyard with high walls. There were two problems with this, first of all no natural light and second of all there appeared to be seats out there for smokers that looked right into our room. I went downstairs and asked to have the room changed and was told there was none available at present but there would be in the morning. After spending the night in the room we were really wanting to change as we realized it was a disabled room and therefore the shower was open and let water all over the bathroom despite the curtain and everything in the room including the hanging bar in the closet was lower and therefore we could not effectively hang full length garments. In the morning my husband asked about the room change and was told it was not possible as they were short staffed and couldn't clean the extra room! We weren't happy with this response so asked a third time later in the day and we were assisted by a very helpful woman who asked 'did you request a disabled room?' She immediately a moved us to another room on the 8th floor. This room had a better outlook from the window and the bathroom had a shower in a bath which prevented the water going over the floor. The rest of our stay was great. The breakfast was adequate for our needs and the wifi was fast. Although the service wasn't excellent I would definitely recommend the hotel for its modernity, prices and location.

Reviews.Title: “DECEPTIVE - not pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nikki R
Reviews.Content: We traveled 900 miles by car with our 9 lb. poodle under the impression we could bring her here. Upon arrival, they will give you a contract that says you cannot leave your pet unattended. We were unaware of this policy when we rented the rooms online. Well, how are you supposed to go to dinner or go inside museums like that?! Not only that, we've been called 3 times already - including 1:40 in the morning - by the front desk claiming our dog is barking. We had her with us all evening. They even sent up a security guard to accost us! There are three other rooms on our floor with dogs and they have been barking and yipping constantly, unlike our dog. She is well traveled. Also, we did not have towels or shampoo for our morning shower. The location is very convenient, but the brusque treatment we've received from the staff is maddening. Not to mention, we're going to be here five more days...and we can't do anything because we can't leave our dog. Did I mention it was New Year's Eve last night and that everyone was partying and boisterous? We were probably the only people asleep when we received our 1:40 AM phone call. We're actually not drinkers, we just like New Orleans (we've been here twice already and loved it before). Thanks a lot, La Quinta. You've ruined our trip already.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: khall0102
Reviews.Content: Very nice La Quinta with clean rooms and friendly staff located within two blocks of the Canal Street Trolleys and the French Quarter. The rates were reasonable and includes breakfast (if you get up early enough). Harrah's Casino, the Riverwalk Marketplace and the Creole Queen Riverboat is also within easy walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable rates, pet-friendly”
Reviews.Author: absolute_alex
Reviews.Content: This property stands just two blocks from the French Quarter but is peaceful and quiet. It is close to everything that you are likely to want to see in New Orleans. The museums and art galleries are a stroll from the hotel, while the Garden District is a streetcar ride away. Wonderful restaurants are all around the hotel, with a fantastic variety of choices, from local cuisine, to great cafes and other ethnic choices. The room we had was reasonably sized, we stayed 4 nights with our dog and never felt that it was too small. The decor is contemporary, with bright colors such as lime green paintings & blankets. The lobby is funky with the cute multi-color dotted armchairs and soothing color scheme. However, I have a few bugbears with the cleanliness of our room. The housekeeping/ upkeep is on the sloppy side. For instance, the corners of the bathroom floor look a little grimy, the grout on the bathroom countertop is accumulating dirt, while the air conditioner & vent in the bathroom are both dusty. The tap in the tub is also chipped. After housekeeping was done with our room, there was still a few strands of hair on the bathroom floor and bits of dirt on the carpet. I understand that this is just a job for the housekeepers but wish they made more of an effort to clean the rooms and maintain the condition of the hotel. I would rate this hotel as 'good' or 3 and a half stars but since that isn't an option on Tripadvisor, I couldn't justify the 4 stars for 'very good', hence I settled for the 'average' rating. Overall, this hotel would be a good choice for someone traveling with a dog or cat as there aren't too many hotels that accept pets or do so without charging an exorbitant fee. Other positives include free internet (sluggish in the evenings) and free breakfast (just so-so).

Reviews.Title: “Budget suite + contemporary decor = a NOLA keeper”
Reviews.Author: AlikaAlex
Reviews.Content: It's nice to a see a budget suite hotel that doesn't look like it was pulled from the early '90s. It looks like La Quinta has stayed true to its budget roots while still doing an impressive job bringing this property up to date design-wise. In town for a week for the Rotary International convention, during my initial search for lodging options some more upscale lodging options did look tempting, and while the W New Orleans beckoned, I couldn't pass up the opportunity to see La Quinta's newly remodeled, but affordable, property. The free "Bright Side" continental breakfast (plus waffles) was a dollar saver, and while I found some of the available breakfast food options uninspiring, they were included in the room rate after all and probably kept me from overindulging. :-) And it's tough to justify the high wi-fi charges of so-called "full service" hotels when budget lodging options such as this one offer it for no additional charge. Our one-bedroom suite was decorated in La Quinta's newer, brighter color palette and included an imaginative take on the sofabed concept on which our daughter had no trouble falling asleep. It was a bit bothersome to be located overlooking the pool deck while actually on the pool level, as we had to keep our window shades drawn to prevent pool-goers from seeing into our room. That said, our daughter couldn't get enough of the admittedly small pool which may well have been the highlight of her week. While no proper restaurant is located in the hotel, we found a nice custom-built burger restaurant across the street which felt very cozy, laid back, and welcoming. It's also possible we may have partaken of the local Domino's one rainy evening. Next time I'm in town and need somewhere to stay on a tight budget, this La Quinta will be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay in New Orleans with kids and dog was very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: TampaRobbinsNest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight on our trip to Texas this summer. We wanted to be near the French Quarter with kids and a dog. This is the most cost efficient hotel in the area that allows pets. You are usually in dumpier places for cost efficient dog hotels but this one was very clean and the employees were super nice. We were put on a floor with a lot of other dog owners apparently, every time we walked by a few doors dogs would bark, but we never heard them over night. Room was clean and spacious, only thing is if we did not have a dog I would have requested not to be on a pet floor. We walked to the French Quarter for the evening, we've been a couple of times so we knew the areas we wanted to visit. If it is a first time it would seem like a very long walk however. Lots of traffic crossing Canal and after dark I would have rather had a car with two small children. But we made it by walking all around the Quarter with dinner and shopping without too much complaining, and the kids were beat by the time we made it back safe and event free. Would have felt unsafe walking by myself however, darker streets and a bit hard to find in the dark FYI. Another tip, to walk you pets during your stay a small park is about 2 blocks away, plan for a trek a couple of times a day while you are there. We tried the continental breakfast the next day and it was fine, yogurt, pastries, bagels, boiled eggs, coffee etc. My picky girls found plenty of things they would eat. Overall great place for the price in the FQ.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Water Problems”
Reviews.Author: Harold P
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location (near Canal Street and Street Cars) is excellent. However, the hotel did not maintain adequate hot water supply after the morning hours. We were there for seven days to enjoy the city, but by 7 PM each day, there was no hot water. Showering after being out all day was not fun when returning to no hot water. The water pressure was weak too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff, Service, & Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: TINAis
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times. First time was a bit of a nightmare as there was an uncontrollable fraternity/sorority on our floor - sleepless before Ironman. BUT, the king room and suites I have stayed in were VERY CLEAN and contemporary. Last week's stay was PERFECT! ALL of the STAFF are incredibly accommodating and professional (special shout out to Eddie and Melody)! Will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ScottyG777
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. On my first trip to New Orleans, my client booked me a room at another hotel and once my assignment was done, I switched hotels to try out this La Quinta Inn. I'm a huge fan of La Quintas so I wanted to try it to compare the two and also to get the points. The room was super big and modern with a great bed looking out over the city. What a view from this area too, nice. The bathroom was also big and well-stocked with nice toiletries and fresh, fluffy towels and was as spotless as the entire room was. The mini-fridge is always welcome, especially for multi-day stays. The location was perfect, literally right in the middle of everything so walking to sights or restaurants was a breeze. It's close to the street car lines too so if you're going farther than you can walk, you can jump on one of the street cars. The breakfast was great with eggs and oatmeal and decent coffee, along with the usual rolls and muffins and breads, cereals, etc. There are a couple of Starbucks nearby if you're into dark coffee like I am, but I'm sure there are local coffee places there too with great brew. This will most likely be my hotel of choice in New Orleans on any future trips. It's a great hotel and the folks working there are as nice as everyone else in NOLA is!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Chipod
Reviews.Content: Sayed here weekend after Thanksgiving. The suite had a unique apartment-like floorplan. The staff was helpful and friendly without being intrusive. Loved the location of the hotel and was able to walk to the French Quarter easily. Incredible value for a suite in downtown New Orleans. Free Wi-Fi was nice. Would definitely recommend to someone needing a very reasonably priced suite in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Our go to location in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: macndave
Reviews.Content: By far our choice in N.O.. Reasonable rates, excellent location, clean rooms with fridge & micro. Easy walk to Harrah's or the Quarter. Staff friendly enough. Average breakfast but ,then again, it's free. We arrived a bit early this last time and after trying to reach housekeeping to see if our room type was ready the young lady upgraded us to get us in. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what was needed-appropriate price/value”
Reviews.Author: SWFTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: Stay in NOLA a great deal of tiem and often. After 'supporting' a particular hotel for quite some time decided to start staying at other places and just 'selected' this La Quinta this trip past. It is basically exactly as that which they proprt. It is a decent enough higher-end three star hotel. It is a 'show' pony in that it looks pretty at the first glnace, yet the 'works' part is not there. I am not sure if teh economy has hobbled its staff?! They were NOT very attentive to anyone witnesed by this traveller (inclusive of self). TImes when needed they never p/u phone from internal calls, yet would when calling in on cell-phone (how chinsy is that?!). VALET service was OK -- yet VERY slow to bring vehicle up and the hotel was next to empty -- again query of staffing/vs income (understood yet it affected our schedule twice negatively). Breaky was status-quo for three star PEFECT location for easy access from and to that which you desired (and far enough from FQ so one can sleep :) Recommended in general!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no hot water”
Reviews.Author: sls5
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the La Quinta this past weekend. It is not exactly IN the French Quarter, but very close. The location was great, breakfast crazy busy with kids and families. Our biggest complaint was the lack of hot water for the shower. Over the 2 days between my husband and I (4 showers total) there was never hot water. We asked at the desk and were told that they only have one hot water tank. Barely warm water is not good enough ever, but certainly not at $150+ per night. One day we returned at 3:30pm and our room wasn't cleaned yet. The housekeeper did clean it then, but we had to go back out and wander around for 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Always My # 1 Choice”
Reviews.Author: Krystle C
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in new orleans during mardi gras season. The hotel was very clean, and staff were very friendly. They also had extremely comfortable beds :) My only problem was they charged my card twice. So everyone make sure you check you accounts. But overall i loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls but good location”
Reviews.Author: adl08
Reviews.Content: Pros: - friendly staff - complimentary continental breakfast (yogurts, fruit, cereal, oatmeal) - comfortable bed - walkable to most places we were going - clean Cons: - walls so thin we could hear our neighbor sneeze or walk across his room - terrible coffee at breakfast - cost was $100 during the week and $200 on Friday night for the same room

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: travelingBecks
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at La Quinta during a quick trip to New Orleans and were very happy with our stay here. We hadn't booked anything so just rocked up without a reservation and were given a really good rate. The manager happened to be at the desk, he was really friendly and had a bit of a yarn to my husband which was a nice welcome! The valet parking was really well organised and took the stress of having to worry about parking the car off our hands. The car return when we left was very speedy too. The hotel is really clean it looks like it has had a recent refirbishment. We found our room to be very homely and the bed super comfy. The breakfast was good, although we prefered to try some of the local places for breakfast so didn't have it either morning. The location to Canal and Bourbon Streets was perfect for us.... a quick 5 minute walk and you really are in the centre of it all... without having to deal with all the noise from partiers, musicians and traffic. If I was to ever come to New Orleans I would definatly stay here again, or recommend it to any friends or family. The wifi was a little slow up in the rooms, alot quicker down in the lobby. With all the other benefits of location and great price it really was a small price to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: MichelleC10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Jazz Fest, and were pleasantly surprised. Since the price was good, we had low expectations. But the room was decent-sized, clean, and updated. And the breakfast was well stocked. We were happy we could park the car and walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good rate, nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: Wonderful front desk service, modern clean rooms. Decent breakfast.. Good location! Two drawbacks, one, the internet was super slow and sometimes non-existent. I was there for work and the room was set-up for business but not the internet. It was a major pain. Two, the gym kind of sucked. I work out everyday while out of town for work and the gym had old equipment and the tv had no remote.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here! Position was awesome and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: KaFr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our trip through USA and I am so glad we did. I was worried when we first arrived as it looked like it was too far from Bourban Street and not quite in the French Quarter as I expected. However, it was a very close walk (5 min) and with so many people out at all hours when my husband and I walked back late at night (early morning) I felt safe. There was a few junkies but they were easy to ignore. The reason I loved this was the awesome position. While being close to Bourban Street it was far enough that I didn't have to sleep with all the noise from that street! The staff on the concierge desk were extremely helpful. The best places we ate were all on recommendation from them. When we needed items for our room they were quickly brought up. The rooms were clean and facilities for breakfast great. We had my mother with us and we used the sofa bed but since the main bedroom had doors and its own TV it was like a 2 bedroom apartment. My favorite thing was the washing machine which, after a month of backpacking was wonderful! The pool is small but suitable and we dipped in a few times. It was really hot but luckily the bedroom and lounge had separate air conditioning units so we could all sleep comfortably. I loved New Orleans, the food was amazing and the place was vibrant! It was my favorite place on our whole trip and I am just glad we stayed here since it was central to everything but far enough that I didn't have to worry about all the noise from Bourban Street. I highly recommend this place if you want to experience New Orleans French Quarter but you also want to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Dmills58
Reviews.Content: Came to NO to stay 3 nites before cruise and 1 after. Had a room reserved at "nicer" place for 1st 2. Walked into La Quinta off street and made reservation for last 2. Very pleased with stay here. Great service, very clean, true Southern hospitality. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bullzeye82
Reviews.Content: As with most other La Qunita's, it's best assest is that it is dog friendly and not just for 40 lb. dogs and under like most other dog friendly hotel's in the business district. I must say though, that the enviorment outside is not very dog friendly, having to walk two blocks to find grass. The staff was helpful and friendly and the room was spacious and clean. If you're tired and looking for good delivery...Cafe Roma's has awesome pizza and delivers straight to your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and great location”
Reviews.Author: may1214
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to all attractions. Helpful staff. Very good breakfast. Free wifi. Clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean.”
Reviews.Author: bridget138
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the better La Qunitas in the area. Clean, staff was friendly. Really close to the Quater. Parking was expensive when I went, but that is with all the hotels near the Quarter. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, walking distance to Canal Street and Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: cherrycola81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our caribbean cruise for a couple days. When our cruise was delayed due to Tropical Storm Lee, we were able to extend our stay for another two days. Breakfast is provided daily, there are cereals, toasts, bagels, fruits, hard boiled eggs, and waffle makers. This hotel is within walking distance to Canal Street, the French Quarter, and Bourbon Street. Nearby restaurants that we visited are Acme Oyster House and Daisy Dukes Restaurant. There is bus stop one block away from the hotel, and we took the bus to go to the zoo. Bus fare is $1.25 and it took about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: SlammaMama
Reviews.Content: We needed a dog friendly place and wanted to be in the city, so when we ended up here we were skeptical that it would be what we hoped for. From Erica at the front desk--super nice and helpful--to the comfy room and convenient location --only a block from St. Charles streetcar and two from Canal St.--we can only quibble about 2 things: the newly appointed rooms, which look stylish, have oriented the beds so that the sun is in your eyes the minute it peeks up. Not cool after a night in the Quarter. But the bed is nice and comfy, plus they provided extra pillows. And there is no coffee in the lobby area except at breakfast time. We weren't there to eat, of course, but complimentary coffee is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a really low rate”
Reviews.Author: ChristyRoadtripper
Reviews.Content: Finding a dog friendly hotel in French Quarter w/out paying a ton in fees is tough, so we went to our ol' reliable, LQ. One of the best we've stayed at! Excellent location off Canal, right next to the other big name hotels. Yeah you have to pay for valet but you can't avoid that anywhere there. Valets were nice and brought stuff up to us that we had forgotten in the car. Room was shockingly big, with a decent bathroom (someone here complained about water pressure: you have to make sure switch btwn tub and shower is all the way up). Can't believe we got that location and quality at la Quinta prices!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Sem0097
Reviews.Content: We went down to new orleans for a quick business trip with some pleasure on the side. The hotel is located ab a block from canal street which is basically the hub for all of new Orleans attractions. The hotel was sufficient, but by no means was it luxurious Luke many of the other historic hotels in downtown new Orleans. Our first room did not have a working air conditioner, however the front desk quickly alleviated the problem by switching rooms. I would highly recommend any of the Dickie Brennan restaurants downtown as long as you don't mind spending a little bit more on some excellent quality Cajun cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding LQ!”
Reviews.Author: SantaClausHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: Great location as all have stated already ~ wonderful front desk staff, helpful with maps and tips on where to eat within walking distance. As Elite members we were immediately offered our free upgrade and at this location it was a 2 room suite on the 12th floor and it was HUGE. I like the updated orange colors btw! Bed was comfy, room was very clean, fridge was already cold and the a/c was awesome! Yes, parking was $26.00 but I am pretty sure that all the hotels downtown are similar, with a few even more $$$. LQ is the only good chain that does not charge an extra daily fee for pets or a ridiculous non-refundable deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great price, crummy parking”
Reviews.Author: TexAggie05
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at this particular La Quinta. Pretty good location and great value for the room. It was a very quiet hotel, which sometimes is hard to come by these days. Friendly service all the way around, including the valet attendants. Only complaint is that parking is pricey! With tipping we are talking about $30 for one night. It took at least 15 minutes to get the car. The attendants are nice, but the hotel lacks the space for proper parking, especially in front of the lobby. I would suggest knocking the price down to about $15-18 until it can be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm. . . So-so.”
Reviews.Author: Nell417
Reviews.Content: We used to love this hotel for its location and good prices. We must have stayed here 20 times. However, after a major remodel a few years ago, the place is not so good, and I think we will regretfully give up staying here. The awful orange 70s decor is part of that, plus broken lampshades, and a blocked sink which we tried four times to get the management to fix--these have put us off. The valet parking service is a disaster--not only do you have to wait but they leave parked cars blocking the entry so you cannot get out once you have got your car. After a 15 minute wait we sat in the car for another ten trying to leave, while four or five employees stood around. I asked two of them if they could move a car so I could get out and they said they would and didn't. Eventually it took three different people (including watching strangers!) to talk to them to get them to move the car! Add these things together and we are just disappointed in what used to be our favorite place to stay in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Joefromphx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta Downtown New Orleans for 4 nights in July 2011. The hotel location is central to all the NO attractions. Walking distance to Bourbon St, but far enough away to be peaceful and quiet. Check-in was very smooth and the staff was courteous and competent. My only negative is that parking is pretty expensive, but it is the same at most nearby hotels. We stayed on the 15th floor and the room was large and comfortable. The rooms were quiet and we rarely heard any other quests. The room seemed recently redone and the furniture seemed new. the WIFI in the room worked well and was pretty fast. The included breakfast is pretty standard, but does include waffles. Overall, the La Quinta Downtown New Orleans was really good and I could not have been happier with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: maxx3000
Reviews.Content: We loved the fact that the hotel was far enough away from the party scene but close enough to walk for a visit. The hotel was clean, safe, front desk staff and valet staff were very helpful. We enjoyed the pool which is located on the roof top. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: mercuristarz
Reviews.Content: I have to reiterate what many of the reviews are saying. It is far enough from all the downtown madness BUT within walking distance to everything - which is a very GOOD thing. The room was clean and bed was comfy. I'm not going on vacation to stay in my room. So it was worth the money to be close to all the attractions but not so close that you cannot rest. The downside is the parking fee of $30 (it's a one time fee no matter how long you stay and freedom to come in and out as you please) and the small rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “cLEAN AND friendly”
Reviews.Author: miamiman1967
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. Parking is expensive $25 a night! plus we felt safe!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaltsNonna
Reviews.Content: We traveled to New Orleans in 2010 and stayed at this wonderful hotel. La Quinta Inns are always pet friendly which is a plus because we always bring our four legged children along on most of our trips. The Staff gave excellent customer service. The room are a nice size and very clean. The park to walk the dogs is only a couple blocks away. We are planning another trip to New Orleans Fall 2011 and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: kjalsbury
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at La Quinta Inns. This one is located only about two blocks from all the action on Bourbon Street. Excellent location, clean, great room. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone going to New Orleans. Only drawback was the $30 to park our car in their garage.

Reviews.Title: “Inattention to detail”
Reviews.Author: jwj63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for three nights. Nothing was terrible, but lots small things added up to a disappointing experience. First the positive... The room was priced right, even the suite which I'm glad we got. Lots of room and the main bedroom closes off, leaving the kids to a pull out sleeper and their own TV separate from the adults. Also the location was great - right between Poydras and Canal. And it looks like some effort was made to update the room with some contemporary design. On the flip side... 1) the room smelled stale and damp. The cleaning lady was next door and sprayed the carpet upon our request, but the smell never quite went away. 2) The toilet made a horrendous sound each time it was flushed, and needed multiple flushes to be effective. 3) Two lamps did not have light bulbs. 4) The bed was hard, and the sheets were old and worn. 5) The hotel allows pets, and there was a barking dog next door 6) Only partially cleaned room by housekeeping one day. 7) We had hoped the pool would be a real amenity, but it was a cruel joke. Maybe 20X10 feet total size with 4 ft maximum depth. My son looked at the water and said - "Wow - that's murky." We did not use the pool. 8) Poor front desk service. I called three times and got no answer, so I had to go down myself. When I told the desk clerk that I had been calling multiple times, he just stared at me and offered no response or apology. 9) No bar, no restaurant, no room service. We knew this ahead of time, but the impact really added up over the four days. Again, no single one of these things was terrible, but add them up consistently over four days and you get a very disappointing stay. I'll pay a few bucks extra next time and stay somewhere with better attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: Dbram
Reviews.Content: We stay here because its convenient to downtown within walking distance. We can walk to French Quarter, the Mississippi Levee, Harrahs and lots of eating places between Decatur and Royal St. Many art shops and musuems along the way. The service is good, its clean, the beds comfortable. The view is great toward the river. And because we stay here a lot, we get rewards!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: liz1567
Reviews.Content: We were so very pleased with this hotel! The staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean and smelled really good in the lobby, great room and excellent location. We came to visit New Orleans with our three children. We stayed in the two bed room suite which was gorgeous, set up nicely and very comfortable. The breakfast was great and they keep it well stocked. We walked to the French Quarter, River Walk etc so the location was great. Other perk: Free wifi :) We chose to take a cab to the hotel in lieu of paying valet costs but be warned the cab from the airport for a family of five cost $70 Really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised”
Reviews.Author: nycrb
Reviews.Content: Usually when we arrive in NOLA, we get anxious about where our car will be parked. Not only was the hotel easy to find, but the drive in entry with portico made you relax right away. The valets were great, even the day we were checking out we wanted to walk to Mother's (hmmm) to eat lunch and stroll a while, they held my car out front in the shade til we returned. Nice touch. The down side to parking? 26 bucks. Thank goodness the business covered it. But, then again, hardly anything is free in NO. I can't say as much for the front desk crew, but in retrospect, it didn't matter. Our a/c wasn't working, and in 15 minutes, the maintenance fixed the problem; thank goodness. The hallways to the room were not exactly clean, but the room was clean and very quiet, with lcd tv, fridge and micro. The bed was very comfy, as were the sheets, clean and soft. And free wireless. In NOLA! Which is not always the case. Anyway, we've stayed in many hotels in NO, and although there are others we like, this is one in the top ten.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: eshia01
Reviews.Content: We went to NOLA for a destination wedding. My other group of friends stayed at the Omni Crescent 1/2 block away and we saved $50/night compared to them. The hotel was clean, appears recently renovated. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly. The only problem was there were no safes in the room which I found a little odd for a chain hotel. My ipad and camera equipment were still in my room after coming back from my outing, which I guess is a good thing. The location is ideal if you don't want to be in the madness and noise. It was nice to come back to a quiet hotel after a long night of partying. The French Quarter is only a few blocks away, easy to walk to. The St. Charles trolley stop is even closer. There is a CVS closeby too. If you're seasoned travelers like we are, and rather spend your money on going out and eating well, vs. staying at plush hotels. You need to stay at La Quinta for its reasonable prices for the quality you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Anget09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully located between the French Quarter, the Garden District, and the Convention Centre. The rooms were well-sized, though for four people it was a bit tight. The closet was really small and the bathroom doors did not close properly or lock. On one of the days, our room was not serviced and on another day we ended with one towel, while those that were taken away had not been replaced. We also had to call down to ask for more soap as it was not replaced either. There is a tiny pool on the 5th floor roof, though not really big enough for laps it's good for a cool down on a hot day. The fitness centre is right beside the pool, it is basic with some cardio and weight machines, but I didn't use it. The free breakfast was good, most people opted for the waffles, though there was always toast, cereal and yogurt available. The front desk staff and the hotel manager were all extremely helpful and always very cheery.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh.”
Reviews.Author: decue19
Reviews.Content: For almost $200 a night, here's what we got -- a room infested with ants; strange odors (that was after they moved us out of the "ant room"); uncomfortable, creaky beds; weak water pressure; and paper thin walls (we could hear people snoring in the next room). Its only plus point is the location -- you can walk to most places you'd want to see in New Orleans. But most other hotels are similarly near key attractions. You'd be better off staying with them.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: DjsTrip
Reviews.Content: The room was great, as was the overall location. A quick walk to the French Quarter. It was also one of the least expensive options in the area. This hotel was a great choice for my stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical La Quinta Inn”
Reviews.Author: Madtownie
Reviews.Content: I have passed by my fair share of rather ghetto looking La Quinta Inns, but was quite pleased with my hotel selection in New Orleans. Great location. 4 blocks to the French Quarter, but far enough away that it's quiet at night. 2 blocks to the trolley cars, casino, Canal St. and riverwalk. I believe the entire hotel has been remodeled in the past few years. Modern in appearance, but not too trendy. Room were clean and spacious. Bed was comfortable. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful with advice and recommendations. Typical free continental breakfast in the morning. Speedy check in/check out. process. If you're looking for a reasonably priced place to settle for a few days and you're not a hotel snob this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “LA QUINTA : AN AFFORDABLE OPTION FOR N ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: RICARBSAS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in downton New Orleans, close to the river, Bourbon Street and the Convention Center. the walking distance to the french quartes is three blocks and the river is at least 5 blocks from the hotel. The rooms are pracious and clean. The furniture is moden and the decoration too. The floors are on wood. The bathrooms are bigs and has convenient amenities. The free breakfast is limited but enough. The staff at the front desk is not always nice. May be rude in some cases. The relationship between price and service is in average very good. I do recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “convenient location good value”
Reviews.Author: faye57
Reviews.Content: La Quinta is 2 blocks from the French Quarter and near the St Charles & Canal street cars as well as busses. The free breakfast is good, the rooms big and clean, and the staff helpfull. Beds comfortable. It is at the edge of the business district, but it doesnt seem set up for business travellers. Water pressure is low, thats my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - best conference hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: conferenceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Quinta Downtown for the AERA 2011 conference in New Orleans. I was concerned because I had hurt my leg and I was worried about not being close enough, but this hotel was near every thing - bourbon street and the main convention hotels. THe staff went out of their way to be friendly and accommodating. In fact, the business center printer was out of ink and people were having 20 and 40 page documents printed for them at the desk.. (which I found like they were going above and beyond). Their cleaning staff was very friendly and polite and always said hello. Their breakfast area was very clean and they were constantly restocking. They had bagels, cereal, eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt and waffles. The rooms were very quiet, I never heard neighbors. The only thing I would say while stylish the rooms were not as pristine as a 300 dollar a night hotel - (ie.. there was a little dirt in the corners).. I found it sanitary and well maintained but not perfect.. but let's be serious .. if those wall could talk.. I bet cleaning a hotel 3 blocks from Bourbon Street is a challenge. I had a king room that had a fridge and microwave which was great. Internet was a little spotty, had to reopen my browser several times.. but my conference is an internet hog!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Whiterhino77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. I love complaining, but there was nothing to complain about! They are doing a great job. Everything was top notch, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean room. Free WiFi and breakfast included.”
Reviews.Author: Patty1234
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. It's conveniently located between French Quarter and the Convention Center. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. I checked and did not see any signs of bed bugs. I will return if I come to NOLA again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New Orleans hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJ26
Reviews.Content: While it's not a quaint French Quarter hotel, this hotel is a great choice for your stay in the city. The fanciest La Quinta I have ever stayed in. It seems as if the rooms have recently been redecorated, with tasteful wooden flooring, quirky bathroom layout and flat screen TV. Huge comfortable beds too. Location is perfect - 10 mins walk max to the French Quarter. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, But...”
Reviews.Author: HoosierINtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (March 21-24, 2011). The Pros: Location! The hotel is only a few blocks from the French Quarter and is any easy walk to the Quarter. The St. Charles Ave. street car stop is a block away. The rooms and hotel are clean. There is a basic free breakfast every morning, but nothing special. The price was affordable. The valet parkers were very helpful and pleasant to deal with. The Cons: When we checked in we were given a smoking room even though I reserved a nonsmoking room. When I went downstairs to have our room switched the girl at the front desk radioed a maid to see if there was a clean nonsmoking room, she preceded to say, "please hurry and get a nonsmoking room clean because I have a lady who is upset that she didn't get a nonsmoking room." I was not upset and was polite about asking to be switched. The shower was terrible! The water pressure was weak and we could not get anything but scalding hot water. When I mentioned this to the guy at the front desk his reply was, "Yeah, I've heard that before." He didn't offer to do anything about it however. When I visit NOLA again, I would likely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: noella041
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean maid service good. close to bourbon street and the french quarter. Did have trouble walking to eating places later at night with a four year old. wished they had a restraunt. The pool is small wouldnt stay there with children in the summer. Nice to get back from the hustle and bustle of neworleans to nice enviornment quiet mostly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Edistotiger
Reviews.Content: We recently visited NOLA from 3/5 - 3/9 for Mardi Gras. We chose this hotel because they were advertised as pet friendly and my daughter & her husband insisted on bringing their dog for the trip. All of the staff I encountered was very friendly, & patient which was a little suprising considering the hotel was fully booked and very busy. The room was comfortable although the sofa sleeper advertised in the Executive suite room was actually a king-sized futon. My daughter & her husband said that it was very comfortable. However, it is very low to the ground. An older person with bad knees may have problems getting up from it. The bathroom was average; clean and nice size, but nothing outstanding. We had no problems with noise although several other reviews here have complained about that. The only noise we heard was from the street; we heard none from the neighboring rooms. The hotel remained remarkably clean during our stay despite the fact that it was Mardi gras & there was constantly a lot of traffic in & out. The "business center" is very small - just one computer and printer. The continental breakfast had a good selection, although I think that hotel managment should have had more than one person working the breakfast considering the hotel was at max capacity. The one young lady working the breakfast did her best to keep everything restocked and the trash cleared, but it was just too much for one person. Parking is valet only; the rate is comparable with hotels in other major urban areas. I did not visit the exercise room, so I cannot offer any comments on that. My daughter & her husband go to NOLA at least 3 times per year and now plan to stay at this hotel when they come (they always bring their dog). All in all, I would recommend this La Quinta to friends and would stay here again on any future visits to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent selection”
Reviews.Author: ffdoc2
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell if we return to New Orleans this is where we'd stay again. The location at least in our minds was near perfect, two blocks from the French Quarter, easy walk to the river, one block from the St Charles streetcar. The rooms were well appointed, though not luxurious, bathroom was clean and modern, hot water was fine. The microwave and refrigerator were great although we only used the fridge and never the microwave anyhow, but it's there if you want it. the front desk was very helpful and prompt, helped a couple times with questions we had and were always pleasant. The breakfast was as advertised. There were no cooked foods like bacon, sausage or scrambled eggs, unless you count hard boiled eggs as cooked. There were however two waffle makers, fresh fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, juice, coffee, cereal which was more than we make at home anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!...and Pets allowed at no additional charge.”
Reviews.Author: aquablue
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better location. Within walking distance to Riverwalk, the French Quarter, and a block away from the Parade route. The room was fabulous with modern amenities, flat screen TV, and free internet in rooms. The complimentaty breakfast was OK also. Downfall was the $29 per day parking, however I believe this is standard in this location. It's the amount I would have paid to board my dog, so it worked out in the end. La Quinta is wonderful for not charging a fee for pets. (Not sure I would be too happy if I were not a pet owner however). Did not like the fact that the maid knocked on my door at 9am the first morning of our stay. Since I was still in bed, I requested she not bother to service. However, the second morning, I made sure I was out of the room by 9am with the dog. Upon returning at 10am, the room was not cleaned...so at 11am, I took the dog out and asked at the front desk if the room could be cleaned. I was standing there when the receptionist called housekeeping. However, when I returned 2 hours later, the room still had not been cleaned. So during 3 nights, my room was never cleaned. However, this did not affect my enjoyment in NOLA. I would stay here again. However, I would not request a room ending in 02. It is across from the elevators, and you here all the party people coming in all night and morning.

Reviews.Title: “Rock n'Roll Mardi Gras Marathon”
Reviews.Author: ediekens
Reviews.Content: After not happy with my first choice in hotel, I kept searching for hotels that were available for our trip to NOLA. After a a day or two, I found this hotel had an availability. I have to admit, I am SO GLAD i cancelled my 1st choice and went with this hotel. This was perfect for the event we had come for. We were in walking distance to Bourbon street, yet not too close where we didn't hear all the commotion. We were in walking distance to the convention center and the start line. The hotel was clean, maid service always took care of our room, the walls are thin in the hallway, but we didn't have a problem in our room. The front service was friendly at all hours of the night and the valet gentlemen were very helpful and courteous. Breakfast items were well stocked and yummy. Also, when you get a chance, I would HIGHLY recommend eating at Mothers just a block away. Order the Ferdi...you will not regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised!!”
Reviews.Author: jkdaves
Reviews.Content: Great location. Two blocks off Canal. Three blocks from Bourbon. Very reasonably priced. Easy to get to. Very nice and attentive staff. Large King Rooms with Flat Screen TV, Wireless, Fridge, and Microwave in room. Parking was $29 a day. They allow pets also.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay, good central location to all new orleans attractions”
Reviews.Author: beetlesgrandpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, great rates compared to others we checked. Appears to have been updated recently. Very good "waffle" type continental breakfast selection, closes at 9am. Convenient----short walk to world war two museum, riverfront, casino, french quarter. Parades that go down St Charles are just one block away. Same location as high priced hotels....maybe not all the 'pampering as the high priced guys, but at half the price and I would bet the rooms were almost as nice. Check out at noon instead of typical 11 was nice. Five minute, twelve dollar taxi ride to amtrak. I think airport taxi is about twenty two to downtown area

Reviews.Title: “A steal-make sure to check for rate changes”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at $80 or so for a week night at the AAA rate. I happened to check before I left and it had fallen to $54--a steal. I haven't stayed at a LaQuinta in ages but this one is newly remodelled: wood floors in rooms, laundry machine on floor 6, walkable to French Quarter and tourist attractions. Nice yellow and orange motif. A steal compared to the conference rate where I had planned to stay (which was $189). Highly recommended. Also, take the E-2 bus from the airport for just $2. Take the St Charles Street car behind the hotel to the zoo. Very nice and very handy

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TobyandChewie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends. Summer at the front desk was very welcoming and helpful. The location is great- just 2 blocks from Canal. The price is fantastic! Free wireless internet and breakfast was also an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “New Orlean's Best-Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Danma11
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome, the service was always friendly, very modern looking, extremely clean, layout of the rooms was very nice and the price could not have been better. It's in a great part of town that's a 2 minute walk to Canal, Bourbon, or the rest of the French Quarter and just as easy access to the St. Charles and other streetcars. Will definitely stay here again in future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price and Service”
Reviews.Author: DreamySmurfJames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block from Canal Street and two blocks from Bourbon Street and one block from the St Charles Street Car. We stayed for one night and The night auditor was very polite and professional (her baby looked like it was ready to pop out right then). She was very nice and allowed us to check in early so we could shower and put our luggage in the room as we had drove all night. The room was very clean and everything worked perfectly. This hotel is a excellent value for the price. Very clean room, great location, free breakfast, free internet and great hotel staff. I highly recommend this hotel. La Quinta is always a great value and they again have lived up to there promise of excellent service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: shawnahagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Downtown earlier this month and had a great experience! It is by far the best value in the city. The complimentary breakfast was great, and all rooms have free wireless internet, which is getting to be a rare find. The location was amazing and within walking distance to most of the major attractions in NOLA. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. All in all, I will stay at La Quinta every time I am in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your pets!”
Reviews.Author: chemmie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for travellers with their pets! There is a park a couple blocks away to walk dogs. There are many dogs being walked around the hotel. Very popular hotel for people with dogs. If you don't like pets, I would suggest somewhere else. Great location. Walking distance to the French Quarter and casino. Hotel is kept very clean. Rooms are great and have been recently renovated. Bed was very comfortable. I was on the 9th floor and had no problems with water pressure or temperature, which has been noted by other reviewers. My only complaint is the doors allow a lot of noise in. If you are in a noisy hall, you will hear it through the door. We love to travel with out pets and will certainly stay here again. Very nice hotel and a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: lluv2travel
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 days before a Caribbean cruise. Ideal location as close to the French Quarter, Riverwalk and all trolley car routes. Quiet location. rooms were comfortable, breakfast included in rate and no complaints. Would stay here if and when we went back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A purr-fect gem!..just as described by others”
Reviews.Author: debntim1
