Reviews.Content: we searched for a hotel which would accommodate us w 3 kitties! they did more than this. what a beautiful hotel, close to the French quarter..walking ...cafe du monde... 1 negative was Sunny whose wasnt very sunny @the front desk...the others though more than made up for it! and jenny?..made the best breakfest and had an awesome smile!.the room was beyond our dreams, clean..and DID NOT SMELL!...awesome! , great breakfest, no charge for pets..just parking though..?25$/day...but everything more than made up for it! Stay STAY STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: TravelmanLogan
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here the night of Dec 14th enroute to my daughter's graduation in Alexandria, LA. We obtained a rate of $61.75 for the night from the La Quinta website. As other reviewers point out, the hotel is conveniently located adjacent to the French Quarter and Harrah's Casino. Our room was on the 11th floor with a view of surrounding buildings and was nicely appointed. The bed and bedding were extremely comfortable. The staff was pleasant, helpful and friendly and the hotel itself was well kept and welcoming. The continental breakfast buffet was typical and unremarkable. However, at 4:00 AM, a garbage truck showed up on the street 11 floors below and began emptying dumpsters and the noise was EXTREMELY loud. It woke me from a sound sleep and sounded like someone holding a metal garbage can over my head and beating it with a baseball bat. This was the only detractor during our stay. For the price we paid, I would definitely stay there again but get a room with NOT overlooking the garbage pick-up point.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent CBD location with good value”
Reviews.Author: Mayfaere
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel frequently--at least a half dozen visits each year. Rooms are clean, and beds are comfortable. Contemporary furnishings are sparse, and there is no New Orleans atmosphere in the rooms. But, for a convenient and value centered CBD location this one is hard to beat. Staff are attentive; parking valets are not slow to respond. Dog friendly, and you will see many four-legged guests. This is a well-managed LaQuinta with all the usual features including the dull breakfast. But again, this is about a comfortable bed in a clean room, well located and offering good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: Got a special deal via SouthWest airlines. As everyone says, this hotel is in a convenient location, close to everything but quiet for sleeping. Staff very helpful. Room a bit basic with a great view of a fire escape! Had to run taps for a while to get any hot water. Free brekkie and internet use. Would I stay here again? I`d probably try to go slightly upmarket but stay in the same area. But if you can get a good price this isn`t a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bverbos
Reviews.Content: If you plan to walk around New Orleans and especially the French Quarter, this is the hotel for you. Located just 2 blocks from Canal Street (the edge of the Quarter) it provides easy access to all tourist spots and is only one block from the St. Charles streetcar. Our room was spacious and clean, and since breakfast was provided every day, even more of a bargain. The breakfast included make your own waffles, muffins, cereals (hot and cold), hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit salad, yogurt so should appeal to a wide range of tastes. Casino is nearby as well as the riverfront. You really can't go wrong with this La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed- we checked out partway thru our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jill2009
Reviews.Content: New Orleans was mostly sold out for the time we were here, so LaQuinta was not our top choice. The rate was $200 per night, so we were expecting decent accomodations. We arrived at the hotel at 10 a.m. from an early morning flight. We stored our bags and walked around the business district and french quarter. Coming back first at 1 pm and then 2 pm there were no rooms available (check in was 3 pm) and numerous people had set up camp in the lobby. Right at 3 all of the rooms suddenly became available and we checked in. The registration staff was very pleasant, but unable to accomodate our pre-request for a room with a view or an early check-in. On entering the room, we were dismayed. We faced a yellow flat wall (about 3 feet from the window). The carpet was a worn industrial pattern that you might find in a low-rent business. The furniture was dreary and a good portion of the room stood empty, without even an arm chair in it. The free continental breakfast was minimal. There were bagels, cereal, yogurt, a little fruit and make-it-yourself-waffles. The waffle makers were undercooking the waffles so they tasted raw and limp and the syrup was watery and bad-tasting, so you may want to skip those. On the plus side, the lobby was very pretty and the location was great. But there are numerous other hotels there so you've got other choices. After 2 days, we checked out early and moved to another New Orleans inn & suites hotel that got better reviews on this website. It was much, much nicer, with many amenities, for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ChessiePeake
Reviews.Content: We cannot agree more with the most recent reviews. This hotel is in an excellent position only 5 minutes from Canal / Bourbon streets yet quiet. Within 3 blocks to Canal Street and Garden District trams. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms large and nicely decorated. Good breakfast. This hotel would be our first choice if we visit New Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LisaJRay
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, dog friendly. Clean quiet rooms, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location and price”
Reviews.Author: LASusie
Reviews.Content: We were in NO on business and vacation. This hotel is just beautiful, newly remodeled, very modern decor and spotlessly clean. The valet parking staff was very nice and being able to pull off the street in a covered area in NO is very convenient and unusual. Our room was goegeous! Huge with a large desk, plasma mounted on the wall and couch. Our only problem was getting hot water. They promptly sent up a maintenance man who got it going, but the next morning it wasn't so great -- not cold but lukewarm to warm. Other than that, we had a wonderful stay at the LQ New Orleans. Also, very easy walk to Canal and Bourbon Streets.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TNroadtripper88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in La Quinta hotels all over the country because we always travel with our dogs. This was hands down the best experience I have ever had in a La Quinta or any other hotel for that matter. From the valets out front to the front desk assistants to the housekeeping crew this was top notch. The location is wonderful, walking distance to the french quarter but on the other side of Canal street so it is much quieter and less congested. Everyone was so helpful and polite. I went to the front desk because I wanted to buy a stamp. The guy couldn't find one so he gave me one out of his wallet and wouldn't let me pay him for it. Honestly, I will go back to this hotel over and over again. The rooms are nice and large with a refrigerator and microwave. First class all the way. I highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kschaf13
Reviews.Content: The LaQuinta downtown is a very nice hotel with a great location. Two blocks to Canal Street and the French Quarter. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Good selection at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nick hotel”
Reviews.Author: winred
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very attractive room, close to Bourbon St, superb staff, and very affordable. Parking not so good unless valets are used.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers one of the best locations in New Orleans, a close walk to the Quarter and right in the middle of the CBD. Lots of things are within a short walk out the door. The hotel itself has mediocore rooms. Nothing really bad, but nothing really great either. Just a basic hotel room. The elevators are quick and the rooms are renovated. The shower and bathroom was okay. My biggest complaint is that the rooms are poorly insulated. The doors are thin and you can clearly hear everyone walking by and talking in the hallway and adjacent rooms. The hotel offers a breakfast that is ok, but a bit crowded. They have free wireless internet that was good. All in all, it is an okay choice. Just don't be surprised if you wake up to hall or neighboring room noise. I stayed here on a hotwire rate of $59 per night. For that price, I can't complain too much. If I had paid too much more, I would most likely have been unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: dragondog
Reviews.Content: OK, so parking sucks but thats just the area. On the upside you can walk, take a cab, or trolley very easily, and it was very nice not to have to worry about your vehicle. The valets were adequate and friendly. The bellman was AWESOME. We had to unload 2 vehicles, with pets and he maintained a positive, friendly attitude. The room was on the smallish side, but very clean and well stocked. The free breakfast is signature and pretty typical of this chain. If you are stopping in for a quick visit stay here. One down side was the pet walk. The nearest grassy was 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: puppyloveme31
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend there for a surprise weekend away. We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. The room was great and extremely clean. The staff was friendly, professional and very knowledgable of the area. The front desk arranged a tour for us to go on, which was most enjoyable. The valet took a little longer than we would have liked, but all in all, there wasn't much more this hotel could've done to make our stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel in Downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: auntieannie2
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Staff were exceptionally courteous, the room was good size, with an upscale, solid feel to it. Has a well equipped gym but the pool is too small to do any real swimming, the whole pool area is small and plain. The free breakfast is of a good variety with fresh fruit, juice, yoghurt, cereals, muffins etc. The hotel is very quiet for being in the middle of town, it is just a few minutes walk to the french quarter and a 15 minute brisk walk to the convention center, its also right next to the street car. This hotes is a gem and an excellent value when compared to the super high priced hotels close by. Recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nickjw
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant hotel only 5 minutes walk from the French Quarter, with the advantage of much less noise at night. I stayed there during Jazzfest 2010 whilst friends of mine stayed at the Moteleone in the French Quarter - they were much more impressed by the quality and standard of my room than theirs! My room was a 2 x double (photos attached) and was very spacious, clean, modern plus the hotel offers free wifi. Having previously used other hotels nearby in the last 2 years, I will definitely use this hotel again (as will my friends). Although the hotel offered a continental breakfast, I must admit I went for something more substantial at the small diner on the opposite side of the street. For evening meals, I would also recommend The Green Goddess in Exchange Alley - great food and great service from a guy who I assume was the owner.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travel Experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: whippet047
Reviews.Content: After a 20 hour journey from the UK I was desperately looking forward to some sleep in the hotel I had booked and paid for in advance a 5-night stay. However I was told at reception that they would not honour my reservation. Furthermore I was told that New Orleans was full due to the conference I was attending and was informed that I had been relocated to a sister hotel, La Quinta Veterans. Tired and upset I felt I had little choice but to accept the alternative accommodation. I was not told where La Quinta Veterans was located and it was only after a 20 minute taxi journey to a most unsavoury part of New Orleans that I realised where it was. I spent the rest of my time in New Orleans balancing work commitments with visits to La Quinta Downtown trying to resolve the situation. It was never resolved. To make things worse, despite the fact that La Quinta Veterans was approximately half the cost of La Quinta Downtown I have still been charged the full cost of the more expensive hotel. Therefore I am still spending my time, a month after my visit, trying to resolve this issue. I have travelled the world for almost 30 years on business trips and on holidays and this travel experience has been by far the worst I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very friendly staff Thanks Summer”
Reviews.Author: bdtaylor
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. 3 short blocks to Royal St., Than 2 blocks to Bourbon St. Hotel staff was great. Summer at the front desk booked our tours, and answered any questions we had. I will stay here again when I go back to New Orleans. Bourbon street was awsome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Qualty of This Hotel Made My Trip Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Sp0rty
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at this hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable, great beds, and the room was huge. It was a few blocks from Canal Street, Bourbon Street, Harrah's and River Walk. Best of all it was a great value. The people at the front desk were great, especially Summer. Lots of great restaurants are nearby. The parking was $25 per night but not as expensive as some of the other hotels. (If New Orleans would like to get visitors back, perhaps they should create reasonable parking.)

Reviews.Title: “Not just a good value but what you would expect at a higher priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: simpleandfree
Reviews.Content: Very clean and great location. We got a room on the 10th floor for 99 dollars. So close to everything that we wanted to see downtown. We also had to reservations just found the place as we came into town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: thehuddys
Reviews.Content: Great value and within walking distance to Bourbon Street, The Louisiana Superdome, ect. Everything we wanted to see, we could without driving. Only downside was that we had to wait quite awhile (30-40 minutes) for our car. It was parked by the hotel valet and because of contract changes, the lot isn't as close to the hotel as it used to be (or so we were told.) Even so, we would stay there again. Great service, friendly staff, great price for the part of town it's in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: gailcook
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful, room was very clean and beautiful! Walked into the French Quarters to a wonderful seafood resturant - in all our group of 10 had a great time in New Orleans thanks to the staff of this hotel. We plan to stay here every time we visit on our way to Baldwin to work at the UMCOR depot. Would recommend it for every group!

Reviews.Title: “It is terrible. Bad service.”
Reviews.Author: unhappytraveler71
Reviews.Content: The receptionist gave us bad information about the time to take the breakfast so we lost it ,the first day, bad information about cost of the room and the bill. When i had my credit card statement, they charged more money, the person in charge is very rude and unpolite and the manager never fixed my problem after to complein many times. I had bad time, and I have to pay a lot money for their mistakes.The rooms very dirty and they did not clean the room in the time we expend there, you can find dog excrement everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: escapemi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/28 & 12/29. Decided to stay here after looking at positive reviews. It's clean, in a good location, and the front desk was always friendly and helpful. My only negative was the breakfast. Hard boiled eggs were brown when peeled. Vinegar maybe? But weren't too appealing. There were enough other choices to avoid the eggs, but probably would have found somewhere else for breakfast if we had stayed longer. I felt that despite the breakfast, this hotel was an excellent choice for our first trip to NO.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: sugarcoated
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, ive stayed at other hotels in new orleans,so far i enjoyed this one the most.Location was great,breakfast etc. the only problem was there was too many dogs.Other than that it was great! yes i would syay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: Szn
Reviews.Content: We decided on La Quinta based on the reviews on trip advisor, SO pleased we did! Great value. Location is ideal. Close enough to walk easily to bourbon street and all the other french quarter sites.(and its safe) Such good value. Room was comfortable, clean and modern. Staff were great. Parking is worth the 26$, as the car is safe in a garage. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “The greatest value around”
Reviews.Author: Algesoft
Reviews.Content: One of the best deal on these parts of the world â€“ I am not exaggerating. The room was perfectly designed, very pragmatic: not opulent but not cheap looking either. It had hardwood floors in the hallway and bathroom area and the rest was carpet. The beds were comfortable. The closet was small but adequate. There was no mini refrigerator. The entire room gave a feeling of something newly built in a contemporary style. The A/C unit was quiet and true to the set temperature. The breakfast is included. The front desk personnel were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than any LaQuinta I have seen-right up there will the best”
Reviews.Author: CharlaF
Reviews.Content: When you book on line, you are always weary - dont be about this HOTEL - it has all the amenities of the top hotels and reasonable prices. The valet is $26 a day but that comes wtih as many in & outs as you want and you can call ahead and they will have your car at the front door when you come down. Even my other traveler was thrilled. We first had a handicap room which was great and a couple days later came back again and got a regular room and it was great as well with pleanty of access. All the staff were very friendly, helpful and accomodating to all request including reservations at exclusive restaurants at the last minute. I highly recommend this hotel, very close to street cars, gambling, football arena and the french quarter!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: martinjld
Reviews.Content: We originally booked our 4 night stay in New Orleans at the International Hotel, right across the street from the La Quinta. The rooms at the IH were soo bad that we ended up leaving and getting a room at the La Quinta (the rates at LQ were much less than at the IH or at most hotels in the area as well). This place is great! Spacious, modern, clean room, with fridge, microwave, nice flat screen TV (with lots of channels), good air conditioner, comfy king bed, free breakfast, and spacious bathroom with great shower. The free high speed wireless internet was great as well. Very short walk to Bourbon Street or any where else in the French Quarter. I travel extensively and this is definitely a great hotel. I/we will definitely stay here again the next time I go back to NoLa.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - so much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kerri_lousie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel mostly because of cheapness but didn't expect to get anything half as good as this for the $47 rate I got on expedia. Very clean, safe, and just 2 blocks from the start of the French Quarter. New Orleans is more of a dangerous city than I expected of it and there were a lot of places I felt unsafe even though I wasn't travelling alone. This hotel was one of the few areas and neighbourhoods that I felt safe and it was quiet. Would highly recommend. Large rooms, good free breakfast selection, free wi-fi and all very new looking.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jodiwsh
Reviews.Content: just got back from new orleans. the la quinta was perfect. all the people were so friendly and helpful-especially the valets! the pool was small and cold but hey we werent in it long-way too busy! love the nice clean hotel. perfect location. great people. and best they love our dogs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lovemyth
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for our check in and most of our rooms weren't raedy. The incredibly friendly staff - desk person and valets - Gave us a multitude of options of where to spend our time. Everyone was exhasted and needed a drink so they sent us down the block to a cozy laid back bar. When i got back and got into my room , I noted it was quite roomy. An entrance area with closet and cabinets with mini fridge and microwave. Bathroom clean and roomy. Comfy clean bed, comfortable desk area, large Tv, lots of dresser space. All very nicely decorated, the rooms looked exactly as the company advertised. A short walk away from the quarter, and casinos. bad things. ran out of towels and for the whole trip we were short on towels. the front desk tended to be short staffed with the wait being quite long, quite often. Help still always accomadating. Pool is a bit small. It was a 67 dollar a night room and well worth it all considering.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great for the price due to decor, location, etc...”
Reviews.Author: SweetSam84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two (almost adult) children. I thought the location of the hotel was perfect for what I wanted we wanted to do. It was a 10 to 15 minute walk to most of the activities and restaurants we went to. Julia Street (art museums) was a 10 minute walk in one direction, and the French Quarter was a 15 minute walk in the other direction. The "continental" breakfast was perfect fpr us. We were able to load up on waffles, fruit, oatmeal, muffins, and cereal in the mornings, so we only needed a light lunch which saved us money. This hotel will also let you have large dogs in the room....saw a few german sheppards which (if I had known ahead of time) would have saved me 70 dollars boarding costs. There were ants in the bathroom. We called the front desk, and they said they'd send maintenance, but they never did. But that was a small annoyance...not a big problem. The double beds are not full size doubles. That would be a problem if you had two large people sharing a bed, but was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasStar11
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. Attended a conference 2 blocks away and the walk was great. The staff was helpful and even upgraded our room. The room looked just like the pictures online. The only drawback was that the pool was closed for renovation and you had to deal with water pressure issues, but it was nothing that you couldn't live with. It was a great stay for the price and I had no complaints. This is also a great location to visit Bourbon St. and Harrah's, itâ€™s only a short walking distance. We drove to NOLA, but never used the car until we checked out to go home. We will be back really soon.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Value”
Reviews.Author: POKYJ
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant given the name brand, but this hotel was terrific and a great bargain. Location is minutes walk from Canal St and Bourbon St/French Qtr. An easy walk. Hotel I think has undergone extensive renovations recently - everything freshly painted. Rooms spacious, clean with New Orleans flair. Price was one-third of the Marriott a few blocks away for the same night. Terrific bargain.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: LISRELite
Reviews.Content: First off, I confess that the service was poor enough that we didn't even stay in this hotel: when we tried to book a reservation online at the hotel website (cheaper than hotels.com) the security certificate was denied. We didn't want to compromise our credit card information so this option was out. We tried calling the hotel and the lowest rate quote we got was $25 more than the online quote and the staff was unwilling to work with us. This struck us as an ominous sign of things to come so we made arrangements to stay elsewhere. However, since this situation seemed ridiculous (don't these people WANT business??) it seemed a valid comment to post.

Reviews.Title: “Up & Running”
Reviews.Author: stopg0
Reviews.Content: Not your typical La Quinta. High rise just feet from Canal St. and the French Quarter. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on US tour!”
Reviews.Author: Bigdave95
Reviews.Content: We toured the US in OCT/Nov 2006 and this was the best hotel we found. Very clean, great price, great staff, lovely rooms/beds. Great location. Just a great all -rounder! Cant recommend enough!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs found”
Reviews.Author: TravelerUnknown
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs were found on 4th floor. Unknown if exterminator was called. Hotel staff was accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: beezie2
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about this place not respecting the quoted rate and offering poor service on the hotel breakfast, so I was hesitant to keep my reservation. But, I have got to say that my husband and I stayed for three nights and received outstanding service. The breakfast was good (and there was plenty of everything), the front desk was always staffed by helpful employees, and the location was fantastic. We had no problem with our room rate or anything else. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location!Location!”
Reviews.Author: wanderloost
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta when we were in town for a convention. The hotel was only about 7-10 minutes walk to the convention center. It is reasonably priced and is conveniently located to all the major attractions in downtown New Orleans, especially the street car line, children's museum and the river walk. The parking was a little steep at $22/day, it could have been lower. The rooms were clean and the staff were friendly. One small grievance was that the floors could have been cleaner - I got pricked by a glass piece on the floor. I told the staff and immediately the room service took care of it. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal just don't expect breakfast or confirmed rate”
Reviews.Author: Tab74mu
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many good qualities however there are a few things that you have to watch out for! On a positive note - the hotel was very clean and was in a spectacular location. Very convenient to everything you would need to be close to Harrahs, Bourbon Street, Canal Street - and at a very reasonable rate. While we were very pleased with the rate as well as the cleanliness and the location there were 2 things that were just unacceptable. I had read another review where someone checked in and they had the wrong rate - well luckily I read this on here and printed out the reservations w/ the confirmed rate b/c upon check in I was give a rate that was $60 more per night than the original quote. I had to produce the confirmation or I would have been charged the additional $60 per night so please be careful if you are staying at this hotel. I was told upon check in that they had problems with the website not confirming rates but from the looks of the reviews this is just a practice this hotel has - and they try to get you to initial by the rate upon check - in so if you catch it later - too bad you've agreed to the rate so please proceed with caution upon check-in. The only other negative thing we had was the breakfast. If you go in and expect the breakfast advertised please note you will be disappointed. They did offer all of the things on listed on their website however they fill it up in the morning and when its gone - its gone. We went to breakfast at 9AM and they were out of all juices, eggs, sausage, milk, waffles - this might not seem like a lot but it was all they had other than muffins and toast- when you ask for refills the breakfast hostess gets really upset and goes at a snails pace and gives you dirty looks (she likes to sit in the back room and talk with her co-workers) - if this was just a one day thing it would be more understandable but it was every day that we were there so we eventually just gave up on breakfast as we knew we would be disappointed and frustrated from having to wait so long on items. We asked for more juice (again all juice and milk was empty) - waited for 20 minutes - it never came so we just gave up and went and bought our own breakfast. Overall the hotel is fine and like I said in a great location and clean just be extra cautious of your confirmed rate at check-in, make sure to take your confirmed rate with you and do not plan on having the complimentary breakfast each morning that the hotel promises as you will be heavily let down.

Reviews.Title: “Confirm your room rate before you get there!”
Reviews.Author: jab0031ber
Reviews.Content: Confirm your room rate before you physically go to the hotel. I booked my room online, many months in advance, at the www.lq.com website. When I arrived at the hotel with a paper copy of my reservation in hand, the New Orleans staff and manager claimed that my rate would be 50-75 dollars higher per night. The manager would not even look at my paper confirmation which clearly showed my room rate. Be sure and take your complete paper confirmation with you. If they pull this on you, immediately contact via phone their La Quinta 800 number. The 800 number representative is very helpful and I got the rate I had booked. Stay on the line with the 800 rep. while you check in. In my situation they agreed to the rate while talking to the 800 rep., but once they hung up, they, the New Orleans staff, tried to give me a newer rate which was still higher than my confirmed rate. Do not settle for the higher rate!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angelique0721
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Quinta hotel in downtown New Orleans while he was in the city for a conference. We chose the hotel because of other reviews we had seen on TripAdvisor, and were not disappointed. The location was perfect, the hotel was very nice, and the rooms were spacious. We had the chance to check out a room over at the Sheraton (his conference was being held at the Marriott and Sheraton, which were right down the street from La Quinta), and I have to say we were very happy we chose the hotel we did. Our room was at least twice as big as the room we saw at the Sheraton, and for quite a bit less per night (we got our King Room for $105 per night through the La Quinta website). Pros: LOCATION; spacious rooms; pleasant staff; really comfortable beds and bedding. Cons: Valet parking is $22 per day...however, every hotel we saw cost at least that much (no free parking at any of the downtown hotels); no pool; no restaurant or room service. Neutrals: Breakfast was ok--not great, but not bad. They had a waffle maker, which is always fun if you're not in a hurry. Overall, the hotel was great for the price we paid, even when you add on the cost for parking each day. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we go to New Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Room not cleaned daily”
Reviews.Author: mdibruno
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights and the room was only cleaned 3 of those, and that was only after asking for them to clean it. I had to call down 2 nights to get fresh towels for the next morning since it was never cleaned, the bed never made, and trash never emptied. I personally would not stay in this hotel again. I also was not the only one with a problem. I saw another room who put their dirty towels out in the hallway, and a friend that checked in and had to change their room 2 times because it was not cleaned when they sent him up to it. The only bonus is the location to the French Quarter, Bourbon St, and the river.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location and was generally fine. They had wireless in the lobby but not in the rooms which would have made things better. The staff was helpful and directed me to a great local restaurant--Mothers--which was a big plus. I had a very early flight and called the desk at 0445 to book a taxi--no answer. I put on clothes and went to the lobby to find it abandoned except for a security guard who called the taxi. When I came back down, the driver commented that he had been there for 15 min and seen noone. Just dropped the card and left but found it somewhat disconcerting that there was no staff person on duty with the doors fully accessible.

Reviews.Title: “In my opinion this is better than a 2 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: texaspooky
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great value. I am confused by it being a 2 star hotel. I think it is better than that. It was new, clean, large rooms, decent breakfast and great location. Comparing it to other New Orleans hotels I think the condition is above average.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, modern - great value near French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: smartcooki
Reviews.Content: I always look for hotels that are reasonably priced and well-located when I travel. We stayed at this hotel for only $100 per night during the Memorial Day weekend, and thought it was a great deal. It is just a short 5-minute walk to the French Quarter and Bourbon Street, and the rooms are actually very nice and modern for a 2-star hotel. It's in a high-rise building, right next to some other major hotels, and the room rate included a simple breakfast (we only made it for breakfast once since it closed at 10am, and there wasn't much selection close to closing time). The only issue we had is that they didn't have any rooms with 2 beds even though we made our reservations several months ahead and I called to confirm the day before. However, they moved us to a bed with two beds the next night. Would definitely recommend others to stay here if you're looking for a clean, simple room, close to the French Quarter, and a hotel for around $100 that seems nicer than 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown hotel has some issues”
Reviews.Author: Texasgirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta for 5 nights (Sun-Thurs). My husband was doing business in town and so we did not have a choice in hotel because his company was paying for it. I am not a fan of La Quinta so I will not try and not be too negative. I will outline everything with pros and cons. FYI - I am 31 year old female and my husband is 37. We usually prefer Hilton brands or Wyndham. Pros: 1. Very nice staff at front desk, always said hello or good morning, etc. 2. Hotel allowed dogs, which is very nice. We brought our labrador. It was difficult, however, to find places to walk her (not hotel's fault of course) 3. Good location. Walking distance to French Quarter, Riverside, etc (about 1/2 mile - but I like to walk)... 4. I would say above average comfort on beds for a 2 star hotel. Feather like pillows and mattresses were acceptable. I have been to other 2 star hotels where the beds are not tolerable. 5. Decent size room for 2 star hotel. Nice large work desk. 6. We had a microwave and refrigerator (not in all rooms though) which was nice. Cons: 1. I read online that they had a heated pool and whirlpool. I was excited to possibly have the chance to swim. Well the pool was not heated and the whirlpool was full of brown, trashy water ( I should have brought my camera to post picture, but did not have it). It was a shame because, I think winter is the best time to use a whirlpool. If something is not in operation, at LEAST empty it so you do not have to see a contaminated tub of water. 2. I did some laundry since we were here for 5 nights. There are 2 washers and 2 dryers. One of the dryers made a horribly loud noise when drying. The other person in the laundry room told me they have informed the hotel and that they still have not fixed it. If I were the hotel, I would worry about the horrible sound disturbing guests in the rooms nearby. 3. Continental breakfast was OK. I found it to be comparable to other 2 star hotels with muffins, pastries, yogurt (some days), fruit, watery scrambled eggs, sausage (or bacon some days), oatmeal toast, OJ, coffee, tea. Not sure whether to put under pro or con - just average I guess! 4. Speaking of continental breakfast. The first morning we were here the sign stated breakfast was 6-9 a.m Mon.- Fri. We had to wait until 6:45 for it (my husband was a little late 1st day because of that. The 2nd morning it was ready at 6:30 and the 3rd morning it was ready by 6:00. I guess they realized they needed to open on time with our business group. Maybe it is slow season for them so they are not always punctual! I would probably not stay at La Quinta again if I had a choice, although I do have to admit having my dog with me was wonderful! They are in the same price range as a Hampton Inn and I feel Hampton Inn is a lot better of a hotel overall....

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dsess
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times for Jazz Fest. It's a great location. Close to French Quarter. It's right around the corner from the Sheraton where you catch buses to Jazz Fest. The rooms are of a good size and everything is new, since looters stole everything after Katrina. I tried booking here again for Jazz Fest this year, but they were already sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, certainly not 2*”
Reviews.Author: Leigh_S
Reviews.Content: I was a little dubious about this hotel, because of the 2* rating on TripAdvisor and the low price, but I was very, very surprised. The reception was extremely nice, the staff lovely and helpful, the complimentary breakfast extensive and tasty, and the rooms pretty good....and I'm used to 4* hotels. Pros: location - 2 minute walk from Bourbon and all the toursity stuff price standard of rooms IMMENSELY comfortable beds Cons: door of bathroom didn't shut properly Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Great Price- Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: southbiztraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early November 2007 on business, and it was just what I've come to expect from LaQuinta: a clean, quiet room with average amenities that is pet-friendly (I always travel with my dog- a whippet/mix). There were a couple of things that were wrong with the room (small hole in bedspread; toilet continued to churn water after it was full; one "foreign" hair in the bathroom), but they weren't enough to make me change rooms or hotels. I travel every week for work, and I've stayed in a WHOLE lot worse in some small towns where I didn't have a choice. LaQuintas, in addition to having a great rewards program, always provide a clean, quiet room with average, if not updated, amenities, and they are all pet-friendly. The best part of this one on Camp St. is the fact that it's just blocks from LaFayette Square where I can walk my dog, and it's just two blocks to Canal Street and the beginning of the Quarter. It's quiet, too. I never heard anything while I was there, and that's important when you have early morning meetings.

Reviews.Title: “LQ New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: gkelm1
Reviews.Content: We were in NO for the first time and stayed at the LQ on points which were easy and reasonable to use! The location was great! You really are not far from anything and we walked eveywhere except for the cab to/from the airport. The first room we had had "many" hairs on the sheets (yes we do check the sheets....) LQ changed our room and the second room also had a few hairs on the sheets but then changed them. The breakfast was like other hotel breakfast (at least they had one! but when you have Cafe De Monde to go to, WHY....) The gal was picking up the breakfast at around 8:30ish and fully done picking it up around 8:45 so for those expecting it til 9 you were out of luck. The service was not out of this world but they did accomodate us. Oh, the hot tub is out of service, for those long walks we really needed it and it is located on the 5th floor rooftop, the pool had floating bugs in it so didn't do that. I am giving this LQ average at best score.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: tbrowntx
Reviews.Content: In New Orleans, there are varied advance expectations. I was very pleasantly surprised to find this hotel above my expctations. The staff was friendly and efficient, the free breakfast was above average for free breakfasts, the location was only a couple of short blocks to the Quarter and to Harrahs, and the room was large, clean, well maintained, and functional (nice desk and counter spaces). In addition, there was a sofa, microwave and mini fridge. It's not the Four Seasons, but it's much more comfortable and appealing than some of the boutique hotels I've stayed at in New Orleans. One word about parking - expect to pay for your parking anywhere in the Quarter - this hotel has only valet service for $22. I found that reasonable, based on comparable experiences and the cost of my room. Still a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: alt9171964
Reviews.Content: stayed at property july 5-9 for the essence fest. positives: hotel is in a great location approx: 4 blocks from french quarter, about 8 blocks from the superdome, short walk to the convention center. upgraded to a 1 bedroom suites which was roomy with fridge and microwave. bathroom was moderate size. stayed on 14th floor and had great views out of every window. front desk personal were nice and helpful. drawbacks: no onsite bar. (went next door to the international house bar) very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck!!!”
Reviews.Author: let's-see-the-world!
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this La Quinta this past April for Jazzfest. I cannot gush enough on what great a choice this was! For starters, the hotel is just a few blocks away from the edge of the Latin Quarter, literally up the street from Canal, and within perfect walking distance of Cafe DuMonde (just far enough away to make you feel like you worked up an appetite for the best beingets, or allow yourself the delusion that you "walked them off"). Further, the price was amazing! Go to their website directly, they offer discounts! The room was clean, the lobby bright and sunny, and the staff was SOOO NICE!!! I'm headed back to the Big Easy this July and this is where I will stay in New Orleans every single time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sublimebrad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasion, most recently in Jan 2007 for the Sugar Bowl (LSU killed Notre Dame!!!!). The hotel is just a few blocks from the french quarter which is where we hung out for the most part. It is also just a 10 minute walk to the Superdome. The hotel itself looks like it has undergone some renovations over the past few years, maybe since Hurricane Katrina. The rooms were a little smaller that expected but still nice. All the normal amenities. No great window views since it is downtown, just the buildings next door. There is an outdoor pool a few floors up which is pretty cool. The only problems Ive had were with valet parking. They charge you $20 a day I think it was and it took a few hours to get my car the day of checkout. The next time I stayed here I called in advance to get my car but still had a longer wait than normal. Overall its a good hotel. You can usually find cheaper rates than normal and Ive been lucky to get a room on busy weekends (new years, mardi gras).

Reviews.Title: “Great for a 2 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MikahDog
Reviews.Content: We stay in New Orleans hotels at least 5 times a year and noticed the La Quinta while we were staying at the Queen & Crescent during one trip. So while planning our next trip during New Years Eve we decided to try out the La Quinta. We were very happy with the hotel! It is a beautiful hotel, great location, friendly staff, has a continental breakfast, and even allows dogs (although you would have to walk a little ways to find green grass for dogs). We attempted to check in our room at 9 am but our room was not ready. They gladly checked our luggage and took our car. When we came back later that day we were able to check in the room with no problem. The room was very large-- but nothing too special -- normal La Quinta type furnishings. We paid about 120/night for the room and would definately stay again at that price or cheaper...however, if you are willing to spend 150/night I think you can find some better hotel deals in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise 3 day stay”
Reviews.Author: pls709
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here before setting out on a cruise and found it to be much better than expected. It was relatively inexpensive and had a pleasant atmosphere, a very nice lobby and our room was clean and nicely decorated. Our room looked out onto a parking lot but had a great view of some of the high rise hotels and we could see the cruise ships at the river. Did not care for the air conditioner/heater built into the wall under the window. It made a lot of noise and those things are just one of my pet peeves in hotels. My husband and I really appreciated the complimentary breakfast each day. There were scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, pastries, cereal, juice, etc. We found the staff to be very helpful as our airline 'misplaced' our luggage and the manager gave us a call when it was finally delivered the next day. My husband and I walked into the French Quarter each day, sometimes twice a day. Obviously, we like to walk. The only time we took a taxi was one night when it was raining cats and dogs and the other time to get us to the cruise ship. If I must say one negative about the hotel, I think the front desk is understaffed. I kept checking back with the front desk regarding my misplaced luggage and each time had to wait for the clerk to finish a phone call, all the while hearing another call ringing through or a number of people waiting in line ahead of me.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for the price”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at the La Quinta, but my 1st since Katrina and I think I can say the only difference is there are less visitors in NO. (The hotel is the same) We spent 3 nights in the hotel over new years and I was very happy with the service and the room itself. Check-in was a breeze. Took a few minutes and we were off to our room. One thing that did erk me was they never seem to read my notes that I do not want a hotel by the elevator. I did hear some other guests going to the elevator a few times but it wasn't that annoying. Check-out No problems either. They even had a cab waiting for us at 11am (I requested one from the front desk after stumbling in at 4am). Room was nice. We have 2 double beds. No major stains or anything else really gross. We did have one problem with the bathroom door that is was missing a jam so it wouldn't stay closed without jamming something in the door. Bed were fine. Not the best and I didn't leave with a still back so they werent the worst either. Bathroom was a good size. Always had hot water and the toilet flushed if you held the handle down. Fresh towles everyday also. Breakfast was free and good. It was the same one that have at every LQ property. If you got down there at a quarter till 10 it was a bit picked over. I suggest if you are going to sleep late set your alarm for 9 go get your food and go back to bed. Most important was it was a 5 minute walk to Bourbon St. I felt safe on the walk also. I'm not saying you should walk by yourself at night but for the most part there were others around no matter the time of night. Overall I recommend this hotel. I think its a great way to save a few $'s on the room to spend on food and booze in NO.

Reviews.Title: “great price, beautiful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dolmatt
Reviews.Content: we were very impressed with the appearance of the hotel-very classy and clean. The location was great-not exactly in French Quarter, but very close and easy and safe to walk to everything!! The complimentary continental breakfast was great-more than continental (sausages, eggs, waffles, pancakes-excellent!) The only problem we had with the hotel, was the fact that the fridge in our suite was not very cold, but other than that, had a great stay, and would definitely stay again!! We were also surprised at how busy New Orleans was-The city was definitely booming on Friday and Saturday, but really died down on Sunday-especially the Riverwalk mall-almost like a ghost town!! (more than half the businesses closed!) I hope more people plan a trip to New Orleans, the city needs more tourists, and there is definite fun to be had!!! We loved it and plan to go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta- don't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: sukiduper
Reviews.Content: As a former New Orleanian I am VERY understanding about the post-Katrina state of hotels, businesses, etc. However too many things happened during our stay to give this hotel a good rating. No one had stayed on our floor in two months so when we turned the faucet on a cacophony of noise occured for 15 minutes. Also we didn't have hot water for 24 hours- we're pretty sure they forgot to turn on the hot water heater. There were two dead crickets- one underneath my dad's pillow. The valet disappeared with our car key, and we were waiting for 15 minutes- the car was sitting across the street within plain sight! We were still in good spirits despite all this and the front desk woman we dealt with was great. However I left a message for "Mr. Chris" the manager asking him to comp my fiance's parking since we went without hot water, etc. He never even returned our call! I approached him about it and he wouldn't budge. If you're hotel is hanging on by a shoe string, I think in order to promote a feeling of good business they could make such a gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Love New Orleans now more then ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta in New Orleans during Marti Gra o5'. I liked the rooms, the cleanliness but most of all the people. EVERYONE was nice and they made our stay in The wonderful City that much better. In the last couple of weeks I have watched a city that I love turn into a place unrecognizable. I pray for you all and I cherish all the fun memories I have of New Orleans. I wish to God I knew what I could do to make the hurt and pain of the people go away. God Bless you and thank you for showing my family and I what a wonderful City New Orleans is AND ALWAYS WILL BE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: nycbigguy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, at a great location, with a super-helpful staff, a great breakfast buffet, and nice, large rooms. There, I said it all in one sentence...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Location Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place and the price was excellent. Service was good, parking was convenient even though it was $20.00 per day. Breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: mar_87031
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 3 nights at the La Quinta on Camp St. The front desk staff was friendly and ready to answer any questions we had. Our room was clean and roomy. The hotel is within walking distance of the French Quarter and the streetcar lines are only a few blocks away. (We got the five dollar day pass for a trip to the Garden District and a visit to the D-day museum.) I would definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Nice clean room. Walking distance to most everything. Get a 5 dollar day pass and ride trolly to zoo. Have to pay 19 dollars for parking. Friendy staff. Nice breakfast Coffee was to strong. Had a nice little pool and spa, fitness room. Get ac in room had to have a record heat wave when were there.95 degree Got a great rate on orbits for 72 a night. Would stay here again. Only problem was lot of cars checking in and no place to park so had to wait for valet to move some to get into driveway

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the La Quinta Downtown on Camp at Gravier. The front desk staff was very friendly and helped us right away. The location is just close enough to walk to the French Quarter (two minutes) and just far enough to be away from the crowds and noise. A walk to the casino or Riverwalk Mall is just minutes away. Walking to the Superdome is not out of the question from this location. You're also one block from St. Charles and the famous streetcar line. The rooms were spacious and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job keeping up the room. Breakfast was convenient (6-9am pm weekdays and 7-10am on weekends). Across the street is a little joint on the corner, whose name escapes me, but makes excellent po-boys if you sleep past the breakfast hours. This is my second stay at this La Quinta and I would not hesitate to stay there again. One other thing to note is that on the day we left, 6/13, the hotel was replacing all its mattresses and boxsprings with new ones.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Will stay another time.
